column5: Going there from Thursday evening to Sunday morning. Have not been there since mid July. Does anybody want to give me a start up on baits to try out there for this time frame, it's been a year since I last fished there at the end of August and I pulled in a 4lb largie off shore so I know big bass are there.  Going to start off with a 1/20z black/blue bass jig, a 3" chigger craw and a skitter pop...Let's face it, I always catch the bass. Sometimes only a few and other times lot's but I don't think a SKUNK has been issued all year for me.  So, any suggestions? I know green tube's kill there but I won't have boat access(or green tubes) so that's a no go. So aside from that, how has the fishing been out there and most importantly what's been working.  Thanks, MTBF
... uh oh.... do I smell a JINX... ?
Yep, jinx.  There will be a giant slop mat blown up along the whole shoreline now.  But, by the above statement you'll figure it out
Uh oh!!!!!  Can't wait for the report.  Good luck.

Uh oh, do I have some fokes that don't think I can get the job done  I guarantee(yes I said it) that I will be able to catch some bass, and hopefully some bass bigger than a pound or so lol.  Mark my words(Like the Pens winning the Cup, and Skeet Reese winning the classic)! MTBF
I BELIEVE IN YOU CHAMP !! hope you get an nice upgrade for our team.

I will be up and around that area thursday and friday, at a friend's cottage just 10 mins out of campbellford just around the corner from the Church Key brewery, was planning to fish the at the dam's and river targetting smallies and pike  I havn't had much luck in this area myself, would like to know any good shore spots in the surrounding area, maybe we could meet up?
Law of attraction, be positive and believe in yourself.
